triples.name: Higher-order logic
triples.relevance: HOL extends higher-order logic with a machine-oriented formulation suitable for hardware specification and verification.

triples.name: Type theory
triples.relevance: The HOL logic is derived from Church's Simple Type Theory with enhancements for computer manipulation.

triples.name: Axiom of Choice
triples.relevance: The HOL system incorporates the Axiom of Choice via Hilbert's ε-operator as a foundational axiom.

triples.name: Epsilon calculus
triples.relevance: Hilbert's ε-operator is used to implement the Axiom of Choice within the HOL logic system.

triples.name: Formal language
triples.relevance: The paper describes a formal language designed as a basis for hardware specification and verification.

triples.name: Formal methods
triples.relevance: HOL is applied to hardware specification and verification using formal methods principles.

triples.name: Automated theorem proving
triples.relevance: The HOL system underlies an automated proof generator for mechanized theorem proving.

triples.name: Proof assistant
triples.relevance: HOL functions as an interactive proof assistant combining formal specification with automated reasoning.

triples.name: Boolean algebra
triples.relevance: Truth-values and booleans form a standard foundational theory in HOL's incremental development.

triples.name: Mathematical logic
triples.relevance: HOL is grounded in mathematical logic with formal specifications for types and constants.
